timeline.message:
Initial Stitch Functions API

First draft on an API for Functions and BSON type conversions and serialization.

timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Is the intent to have BsonValue... as input arguments? Did you consider Object...?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: It should also throw ObjectServerError since it will hit the server
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Intention was to also let people have an API without too much automatism, but have now updated interface to accept Objects doing automatic conversion for primitive types. Added 'ObjectServcerError' 👍
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.bodyText: Most likely we need to add the user as an argument to functions, but can be added when needed
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Normally we use the whole name to avoid confusion if it is a class name that exists in multiple packages.
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Is this just a placeholder or the actual API contract?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Contract seems to be passing all arguments as one BSONArray with key arguments.
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.message: Collect JVM test results in CI
Update Functions API and BSON conversion accordingly
Fix access modifier for public api
Draft JNI binding for Realm Functions
Add ability to use CodecRegistry for passing values as BSON to JNI
Add default codec registry to RealmAppConfiguration
Expose encoder/decoder variant for JniBsonProtocol methods
Bump OS to get BSON parsing fix for boolean in an array
Add map/document codec providers to default codec registry
Update OS to latest v10 and included fixed tests

timeline.bodyText:
We need to manually add

tags for empty lines to make the generated Javadoc render correctly. This is also missing in a bunch of other places in this PR. Suggested change * *
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Not 100% sure what these FIXME's mean or if they are still relevant?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Initially I though it was possible to execute a function without a user. Apparently it was due to implicitly resolving a current user. Since we want to avoid this implicit resolving of users this is no longer relevant.
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: From before I had an overview of how we managed the underlying C++ objects. Just a reminder for me to check up on it.
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.bodyText: We should probably also expose getApp() and getUser() functions from this class. This is useful if the class is passed around by itself. We are doing something similar in ApiKeyAuth. This would also require tests.
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.message: Add BSON processing error test cases
Add (ignored) test case with C++ BSON parser crash
Cleaned up clarify asserts with error codes
Raise IllegalArgumentException from JNI if BSON argument to callFunction is not a BsonArray
Enabling debug output to debug CI-only issue

timeline.bodyText: Should live directly in Functions I think?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: I kept it here to have all App/User related separately, but as none of it uses internals it can be in Functions. Will move it.
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText:
I guess we should come up with a common name if we are to implement this pattern elsewhere.
Nitpick: Not sure how I feel about this compared to FunctionsImpl. Although FunctionsImpl is normally used when interfaces, it does feel more descriptive in my mind. But I don't have strong reasons and it is entirely subjective.
timeline.author: cmelchior
cmelchior
cmelchior

timeline.message: Fix order or codec providers to fix MongoCollectionTests
Pure debug to track CI-only issue

Revert "Pure debug to track CI-only issue"

This reverts commit 12bf3d96316f17c81f473c178efa756b8163b28e.
Disabling debug output for tracing on CI-only issue.
Ignoring BSON test of dates until fixed in C++ BSON parser
